page.title: 01THE CODICOTE/WELWYN AREA
page.content: The area surveyed lies in well wooded, gently rolling countryside. It contains two villages - one large, Welwyn and one small, Codicote- surrounded in the main by agricultural land. The small River Mimram flows from North West to South East of the block and is the original reason for the existence of Welwyn. To a large extent this is a dormitory area for commuters to London, who travel by car on the A1 motorway which cuts across the South East corner of the area, or by train from nearby Welwyn Garden City.
